mentionedBy.name: Fair Isaac Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Joint venture of Equifax, Experian, and TransUnion created in 2006 to compete directly with FICO Score; the first significant threat to FICO's scoring monopoly

mentionedBy.name: Fair Isaac Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Credit bureaus' scoring alternative gaining traction; VantageScore 3.0 (2013) aligned with FICO's scale and could score consumers with limited credit histories

mentionedBy.name: Fair Isaac Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Primary credit scoring competitor; joint venture of three major credit bureaus offering alternative scoring model with ability to score more consumers than FICO

mentionedBy.name: Fair Isaac Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Primary competitor jointly owned by credit bureaus; VantageScore 4.0 now approved for government-backed mortgages by FHFA; scores 33M more consumers than FICO using alternative data

2010.note: Joint venture of Equifax, Experian, and TransUnion created in 2006 to compete directly with FICO Score; the first significant threat to FICO's scoring monopoly

2015.note: Credit bureaus' scoring alternative gaining traction; VantageScore 3.0 (2013) aligned with FICO's scale and could score consumers with limited credit histories

2020.note: Primary credit scoring competitor; joint venture of three major credit bureaus offering alternative scoring model with ability to score more consumers than FICO

2024.note: Primary competitor jointly owned by credit bureaus; VantageScore 4.0 now approved for government-backed mortgages by FHFA; scores 33M more consumers than FICO using alternative data
